meanings.sent1: The stomatal pores allow gases to enter and exit the leaf.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the stomatal function in plants to understand their growth.
meanings.sent3: The stomatal dance troupe performed a routine mimicking the opening and closing of pores.
meanings.sent4: Her stomatal curiosity led her to explore the intricate structure of plant leaves.
meanings.sent5: The stomatal pattern on the leaf resembled tiny windows on a green house.

meanings.definition: Of or pertaining to the small openings in the epidermis of a leaf or stem through which gases and water vapor pass.
meanings.sent1: The stomatal cells regulate the exchange of gases in plants.
meanings.sent2: Water vapor escapes through the stomatal openings during transpiration.
meanings.sent3: The stomatal race between the leaf and stem determined which released more water vapor.
meanings.sent4: The stomatal pathways resembled bustling streets with gases and water vapor rushing through.
meanings.sent5: The stomatal openings acted as tiny gateways for essential gases and water vapor.
